recipes.title: Strawberry Lemon Napoleon Bites #TheChew
recipes.instructions: Place milk, half the sugar and salt in a medium saucepan and cook until simmers.In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together egg yolks, remaining sugar and cornstarch until smooth.Let the milk mixture cool slightly.Whisking constantly, slowly pour the milk mixture into the egg yolk mixture, a little at a time. Return it all to the saucepan and cook over medium heat until it thickens. As soon as it starts to thicken (and once it does, it goes fast), take it off the heat immediately. Transfer into a stand mixer bowl and add butter. Whip until the butter is melted and the cream cooled to room temperature. Transfer the cream into a smaller bowl, cover with a saran wrap and chill at least 2 hours before using. You can store it for up to 2 days in the fridge.Place chopped strawberries into a medium saucepan. In a small bowl, mix sugar with lemon zest until the sugar takes on yellow hint and the zest releases the juice. Add the sugar to the strawberries along with the lemon juice.Cook on medium heat until the strawberries soften up. Mash the berries with a potato masher.Turn the heat to low and simmer the sauce for about 15 minutes, mixing once in a while.Cool to room temperature, transfer into a jar with a lid and chill until ready to use.Mix powdered sugar with enough lemon juice to reach a drizzling consistency. Set aside.Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.Place the thawed out puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.Roll out thin. Cut with a sharp knife into 2"x2" squares. Place the squares onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or silicone baking mat. Prick each square with a fork.Bake for 11 to 13 minutes or until golden brown on top.Let cool completely before assembling the napoleons.Divide all puff pastry squares in half.Dip one half in the powdered sugar glaze, tops only. Immediately drizzle two lines of melted chocolate on each square. With a toothpick, drag the chocolate lines so make the design.Let set.With a sharp knife, cut each square of the remaining half, in half horizontally.Fill with pastry cream, reassemble. Set aside.Place about 1 teaspoon of strawberry sauce on top of the cream filled squares.Top with glazed squares.Serve immediately.

steps.step: Place milk, half the sugar and salt in a medium saucepan and cook until simmers.In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together egg yolks, remaining sugar and cornstarch until smooth.
Let the milk mixture cool slightly.

Whisking constantly, slowly pour the milk mixture into the egg yolk mixture, a little at a time. Return it all to the saucepan and cook over medium heat until it thickens. As soon as it starts to thicken (and once it does, it goes fast), take it off the heat immediately.
Transfer into a stand mixer bowl and add butter. Whip until the butter is melted and the cream cooled to room temperature.
Transfer the cream into a smaller bowl, cover with a saran wrap and chill at least 2 hours before using. You can store it for up to 2 days in the fridge.
Place chopped strawberries into a medium saucepan. In a small bowl, mix sugar with lemon zest until the sugar takes on yellow hint and the zest releases the juice.

Add the sugar to the strawberries along with the lemon juice.Cook on medium heat until the strawberries soften up. Mash the berries with a potato masher.Turn the heat to low and simmer the sauce for about 15 minutes, mixing once in a while.Cool to room temperature, transfer into a jar with a lid and chill until ready to use.
Mix powdered sugar with enough lemon juice to reach a drizzling consistency. Set aside.Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Place the thawed out puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.
Cut with a sharp knife into 2"x2" squares.
Place the squares onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or silicone baking mat. Prick each square with a fork.
Bake for 11 to 13 minutes or until golden brown on top.

Let cool completely before assembling the napoleons.Divide all puff pastry squares in half.Dip one half in the powdered sugar glaze, tops only. Immediately drizzle two lines of melted chocolate on each square. With a toothpick, drag the chocolate lines so make the design.
Let set.With a sharp knife, cut each square of the remaining half, in half horizontally.Fill with pastry cream, reassemble. Set aside.
Place about 1 teaspoon of strawberry sauce on top of the cream filled squares.Top with glazed squares.
